queryMode.description: The strategy used to query the database.

refinementMode.description: The method used to refine and order search results.

height.description: Image height in pixels, must be divisible by 64 (128-2048, default: 1024)

negativePrompt.description: Negative prompt to avoid certain elements (max 3000 chars)

numberResults.description: Number of images to generate (1-4, default: 1)

prompt.description: Text description of the image to generate (2-3000 chars)

width.description: Image width in pixels, must be divisible by 64 (128-2048, default: 1024)

url.description: CDN URL of the generated image

resources.description: Fund your Grove API Account with 1 USDC to tip creators on the internet.

accepts.description: Fund your Grove API Account with 1 USDC to tip creators on the internet.

Authorization.description: Bearer JWT for funding an existing Grove account. When omitted, the call creates and funds a new account instead.

X-PAYMENT.description: Base64-encoded x402 payment payload returned after signing the payment request described in the initial 402 response.

amount.description: Human-readable token amount to fund the tipping account. These funds can be used to tip creators on the internet. Examples: '0.01', '1', '1.05', '100.10'. Defaults to '1' when omitted. Token determined by 'token' parameter (default: USDC).

network.description: Network identifier. Supported: ethereum-mainnet, base-sepolia, base, solana-devnet, solana-testnet, solana-mainnet. Defaults to base when omitted. Account.network is set on first funding (immutable - represents VM type).

referral_code.description: Optional referral code from an existing user (e.g., 'GRV-ABC123'). Only applies to new account creation. If provided for existing accounts, it is ignored. Invalid codes don't block account creation but are reported in referral_status.

token.description: Token symbol. Defaults to USDC when omitted. Supported tokens vary by network. Check network token configuration.

ReferralStatus.description:
Status of referral code application during account creation.

Included in FundResponse to provide feedback on referral code processing.
Allows successful account creation even with invalid referral codes,
while still informing the user of the outcome.
ReferralStatus.title: ReferralStatus

output.description:
Response model for successful funding.

When creating a new account (no JWT provided):
- account_id, api_key, address, and client_address are populated
- Use api_key as Bearer token for future requests
- referral_code contains the new account's shareable referral code
- referral_status contains feedback on any provided referral code

When funding existing account (JWT provided):
- account_id and api_key are None
- address and client_address are populated
- referral_code and referral_status are None (referrals only apply to new accounts)
output.title: FundResponse

usage.description: Detailed usage metrics for the invocation

resources.description: Base  Solana USDC microbridge discovery. Default example uses 1.00 USDC deposited to the Base bridge wallet. Provide a Solana receiver address and an amount (min 0.01 USDC, max 50.00 USDC, steps of 0.01) to create a concrete bridge quote. The bridge charges a 2.5% commission; the remainder is delivered as USDC on Solana.

accepts.description: Base  Solana USDC microbridge discovery. Default example uses 1.00 USDC deposited to the Base bridge wallet. Provide a Solana receiver address and an amount (min 0.01 USDC, max 50.00 USDC, steps of 0.01) to create a concrete bridge quote. The bridge charges a 2.5% commission; the remainder is delivered as USDC on Solana.

amount.description: Amount in USDC to bridge from Base to Solana. Optional; minimum 0.01 USDC, maximum 50.00 USDC, steps of 0.01 USDC. When omitted, defaults to 1.00 USDC.

receiver.description: Destination Solana wallet address that should receive bridged USDC.

amount_out_usdc.description: USDC amount delivered on Solana after commission.

base_payment_txid.description: Base transaction hash of the bridge payment (x402 settlement).

bridge_id.description: Internal bridge id for support and debugging.

ok.description: True when the bridge completed (sent or refunded).

payer_wallet.description: Base wallet that paid the bridge x402 payment.

receiver_wallet.description: Solana wallet that should receive bridged USDC.

refund_txid.description: Base transaction hash of the refund when the bridge failed.

sol_txid.description: Solana transaction id of the USDC transfer to the receiver.

status.description: Bridge status: 'sent' when Solana transfer succeeded, 'refunded' when Base refund was sent, or 'failed' when both send and refund failed.

extra.name: USD Coin
extra.serviceDescription: x402Factory BaseSolana USDC microbridge for agents. Deposits USDC on Base and delivers USDC on Solana with a small commission.

resources.description:
Find People is a real-time Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) agent specialized in researching individuals and professional entities.

**What it does:**
 Identifies people by name, role, or company affiliation
 Retrieves verified career timelines and professional backgrounds
 Finds similar professionals in any industry or domain
 Synthesizes biographical information with source citations
 Validates identities across LinkedIn, company sites, and public records

**Best for:**
 Due diligence research on potential hires or partners
 Competitive intelligence on industry leaders
 Journalist & researcher background verification
 Sales prospecting and lead enrichment
 Investor research on startup founders and executives

**Powered by:**
Neural and deep search capabilities that go beyond standard search engines to find hard-to-reach biographical details, executive profiles, and professional networks.

**Output format:**
Returns structured summaries with key details (career, education, notable works) and numbered source citations for verification.

accepts.description:
Find People is a real-time Open Source Intelligence (OSINT) agent specialized in researching individuals and professional entities.

**What it does:**
 Identifies people by name, role, or company affiliation
 Retrieves verified career timelines and professional backgrounds
 Finds similar professionals in any industry or domain
 Synthesizes biographical information with source citations
 Validates identities across LinkedIn, company sites, and public records

**Best for:**
 Due diligence research on potential hires or partners
 Competitive intelligence on industry leaders
 Journalist & researcher background verification
 Sales prospecting and lead enrichment
 Investor research on startup founders and executives

**Powered by:**
Neural and deep search capabilities that go beyond standard search engines to find hard-to-reach biographical details, executive profiles, and professional networks.

**Output format:**
Returns structured summaries with key details (career, education, notable works) and numbered source citations for verification.

message.description: Query to find people by name, role, company, or professional criteria

agent_id.description: ID of the agent that processed the request

citations.description: List of source URLs referenced in the response

response.description: Formatted markdown response with professional profiles, career timelines, and biographical information

usage.description: Detailed usage metrics for the invocation

resources.name: CDP Facilitator
resources.description: Best-in-class x402 facilitator. Fee-free USDC settlement on Base Mainnet. KYT/OFAC checks on every transaction.

resources.name: Corbits
resources.description: A production grade facilitator which supports multi-network, multi-token, multi-payment schemes.

resources.name: Mogami facilitator
resources.description: A free, developer-focused, production-ready facilitator for x402 payments. Use it instantly online, or launch your own Docker image in seconds.

resources.name: OpenX402.ai Facilitator
resources.description: The first permissionless, gasless and omnichain x402 facilitator that any x402 server can use without login

resources.name: PayAI Facilitator
resources.description: Accept x402 payments on all networks including Avalanche, Base, Polygon, Sei, Solana, and more! Get started in less than 1 minute. Supports all tokens. No API Keys required.

resources.name: Treasure Facilitator
resources.description: Treasure x402 Facilitator available on Base and Base Sepolia. Supports EIP-3009 compliant tokens including USDC, MAGIC, SMOL, MIO, AI Frens tokens, and more.

resources.name: WorldFun Facilitator
resources.description: AWE World.funs x402 Facilitator enables fee-free EIP-3009 payments in USDC and other ERC-20 tokens, handling verification and settlement on Base so developers dont need blockchain infrastructure.

resources.name: x402.rs Facilitator
resources.description: Independent, open-source facilitator in Rust. Easy to self-host, extend to new networks, or use via our hosted instance.
